page.title: 04LIFE AT THE LIGHTHOUSE
page.content: WE ARE TWO GIRLS WHO LIVE AT ST ABBS LIGHTHOUSE STATION. THE ST ABBS HEAD LIGHTHOUSE WAS FIRST LIT ON 24TH FEBRUARY 1862 AND IT STANDS ON THE CLIFF EDGE 224 FEET ABOVE HIGH-WATER MARK.IT WAS THE FIRST LIGHTHOUSE IN SCOTLAND TO HAVE A FOG HORN.THERE ARE THREE LIGHTHOUSE KEEPERS. WE BOTH LIKE LIVING ALTHOUGH IT IS LONELY AND CAN BE DANGEROUS AT TIMES BECAUSE LOTS OF JET PLANES FLY VERY LOW ACROSS THE HEAD AND THE CLIFFS ARE VERY STEEP. BOTH OUR DAD'S WORK AT THE WEATHER STATION SWITCHING ON THE LIGHT AND SWITCHING ON THE FOGHORN WHEN NECESSARY.THEY HAVE TO ANSWER THE TELEPHONES AND THE BUZZER IN THE HOUSE . THEY HAVE TO WORK AT FUNNY WATCHES 10PM - 2AM,2AM-6AM,6AM-10AM,AND 10AM -6PM. THEY ALSO CHECK THE ENGINES AND THE GENERATORS IN CASE OF A POWER CUT. THEY DO "SPEAKS" TO THE FORTH ROCKS .
